revised_title: Study of Radioactive Decay and Penetration of Beta-Particles in a Simplified Nucleus
tldr: This article presents a detailed study of radioactive decay and the penetration of beta-particles into a simplified one-dimensional nucleus. The authors analyze the conditions of continuity and energy to determine the chance of penetration, finding that it depends on whether the energy of the incident particle is equal to a characteristic energy of the nucleus. The study also highlights the resonance effect in the penetration process.
